metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14610 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: bareos-dir, bareos-fd, and bareos-sd in bareos-core in Bareos 16.2.6 and earlier create a PID file after dropping privileges to a non-root account, which might allow local users to kill arbitrary processes by leveraging access to this non-root account for PID file modification before a root script executes a "kill `cat /pathname`" command.

criterions.comment: bareos: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
